topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Add (Scale-Out) and Remove (Scale-In) Nodes on KVM Hypervisors

body.p: This document describes the steps to add (Scale Out) or remove (Scale In) nodes (KVM Compute Nodes) to an already-installed overcloud on a KVM hypervisor.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Before you begin, ensure the following:

ul.li: The seed VM, undercloud and overcloud are installed using the HPE Helion OpenStack installer.

section.title: Add compute nodes
section.p: New compute nodes can be added to an already-installed overcloud. You can add nodes in any of the following scenarios:

li.xref: Configure compute nodes to pre-allocated empty baremetal nodes
Enroll a new baremetal and then add nodes

section.title: Enroll a new baremetal node and then configure compute nodes
section.p: To add new compute nodes that were not present during the initial installation process, first enroll the baremetal node and then configure the new node.

li.p: SSH to undercloud VM as the heat-admin user from the seed VM:
Source the stackrc configuration file created during the installation process:
Register the new baremetal server in the Ironic database. Replace the CPU, memory, local disk size, IPMI address, and IPMI password values with your baremetal settings:

codeblock.codeph: ironic node-create -d pxe_ipmitool -p cpus=<value> -p memory_mb=<value> -p local_gb=<value> -p cpu_arch=<value> -i ipmi_address=<IP Address> -i ipmi_username=<username> -i ipmi_password=<password>

li.p: The following example for reference:

codeblock.codeph: ironic node-create -d pxe_ipmitool -p cpus=12 -p memory_mb=98304 -p local_gb=1800 -p cpu_arch=amd64 -i ipmi_address=10.12.22.70 -i ipmi_username=admin -i ipmi_password=password
